column3: 3 to 4 cups grated fresh zucchini (700 to 900 ml)
2 teaspoons butter for greasing the pans
2 apples any kind, peeled and chopped , mixed with 2 tablespoons granulated sugar and 1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt (omit if using salted butter)
1 cup  (100 g) chopped pecans or walnuts (optional)
1 cup (120 g) dried cranberries or raisins (optional)
2.0 whole Apples, tart - peeled, cored, sliced
8 cups low-sodium vegetable or chicken broth
1 tablespoon unsalted butter, plus more for finishing
2 cups arborio, carnaroli, or vialone nano rice
1.25 cup lamb or beef stock, heated
1.0 to taste Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
3.5 Tbsp butter, plus more, melted, for brushing
4.0 pieces skinless, boneless chicken breast halves
1.0 8-oz package fresh shiitake mushrooms, stems removed, caps sliced
1.0 0.7-oz package Italian dry salad dressing mix
0.5 8-oz tub cream cheese spread with chives and onion
4.0 servings Hot cooked rice or angel hair pasta
4.0 servings Snipped fresh chives or sliced green onions (optional)
1.0 lbs chicken breasts, skinless, boneless, 1-in pieces
0.75 lbs chicken thighs, skinless, boneless, 1-in pieces
1.0 pound large raw shrimp, peeled and deveined
8 cups hot cooked Chinese-style noodles (about 16 ounces uncooked)
2 1/2 cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)
1lb apples, peeled, cored, and cut into 1/2in dice.
3 TBSP hard cider or apple juice
1.0 teaspoon Better Than Bullion Chicken Base
1.0 teaspoon Dijon mustard (add up to 1 teaspoon more if you want the mustard flavor stronger)
0.75 cup chicken, cooked, cubed (I used a rotisserie from the deli)
1-3 tablespoons of milk or cream- depending on thickness of glaze wanted
2.0 14.5-oz can Tomatoes, diced with onion and green peppers, undrained
2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese for topping
2 medium yellow onions, thinly sliced into rings
1 cup plus 3 tablespoons beef broth, divided
4 boneless skinless chicken breasts, pounded to even thickness
1 teaspoon Italian blend herbs/Italian seasoning (OR ¼ teaspoon dried basil + ¼ teaspoon dried thyme + ½ teaspoon dried oregano)
fresh thyme or parsley and cracked black pepper for topping (optional)
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
2 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped
2 (15 ounce) cans black beans, drained and rinsed
1 1/2 cups chicken broth or vegetable broth
3 cups shredded chicken (I used one large boneless chicken breast)
1-2 chipotle peppers in adobo sauce, minced
3 cups shredded cheese, such as Monterey jack, cheddar or a combination of your favorite cheese
12 7-inch flour tortillas (you can use corn tortillas if you prefer)
2-3 cups canola oil for frying (optional) or 1 tablespoon canola oil to brush the tortillas with if baking
8 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (4 ounces each)
2 tablespoons garlic herb sauce mix (recommended: Knorr)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste
1 28 oz can whole tomatoes with juice *see note (alt: 2 10 oz cans Rotel with green chiles) (alt: 2 cans fire roasted tomatoes)
4 garlic cloves pressed or finely minced
4 ounces shiitake mushrooms stems removed and sliced
1/2 - 3/4 pounds baby bok choy sliced into quarters lengthwise
1-2 packages fresh yakisoba noodles* one package is about 7 ounces. Use two packages if you like lots of noodles. Fresh noodles are usually found in the produce section of the grocery store
